Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Costs of Open vs Endovascular Repair of Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 881 patients, randomised to open repair (n = 437) or EVR (n = 444)

Intervention.evidence: randomised to open repair (n = 437) or EVR (n = 444)

Objective.evidence: The study aimed to evaluate the costs associated with different endograft systems used in endovascular repair (EVR) of abdominal aortic aneurysm compared to open repair.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the total health care cost from randomisation to 2 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 881 patients, randomised to open repair (n = 437) or EVR (n = 444)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Mean device, initial hospitalisation, and total health care costs at 2 years were not significantly different among device systems.
